properties.summary: The Virginia school district of Fairfax County, the tenth largest in the nation, has decided to update its policy concerning school names — a move which could mean a change for schools named after Confederate generals.
properties.headline: Fairfax County, VA to Allow Renaming Schools That Honor Confederates

properties.summary: As institutions and governments throughout the South continue to remove Confederate symbols, aftershocks from the debate over how to handle the Confederacy's legacy still ripple through San Antonio. The backlash against the Confederate flag and other symbols began after Dylann Roof allegedly shot and killed nine people on June 17 at the Emanuel African Methodist Episcopal Church in Charleston, S.C. All of Roof’s alleged victims were black, and photographs emerged of him posing with Confederate flags after the attack.
properties.headline: San Antonio Officials Find 9 Confederate Symbols In Inventory

properties.summary:
On Thursday, Dec. 17, Masters and residents of the city took part in a ceremony where the signs for Old Dixie Highway were removed and replaced with President Barack Obama Highway. The ceremony, which took place at the corner of Old Dixie Highway and West Blue Heron Boulevard, was a step away from the past and a look to the future.

A sign replacing Old Dixie Highway that connected that road to Martin Luther King Jr. Blvd. had already been taken down the day before, on Wednesday, Dec. 16, at 5 p.m. Masters and other members of the commission present on Dec. 17 gave the sign they took down on Wednesday to Johnson. The other sign, taken down on Thursday, would go in the city’s archives as a remembrance of the city’s history.  The city of Riviera Beach Council approved the name change in August 2015. The approval passed with one Councilmember opposed, Councilwoman Dawn Prado.  When Mayor Masters spoke on Thursday, he said that the process to rename the street was one that took several years, though he had wanted to rename the street years ago. Masters also noted that in the past, Blacks could not cross Old Dixie Highway, and there was a dividing line between Old Dixie Highway between whites and Blacks. Masters said that the city would move into the future and that they would bury the racist history of Old Dixie Highway, and move into a place where whites, blacks and members of all races would become one. The election of President Barack Obama was a key moment in the country’s history, he said, in that all people of all races had voted for his election and re-election.
properties.headline: Confederate street name removed from city

properties.summary:
Students, parents, alumni and other community members will weigh in about whether to change the name of College Park's Lee Middle, which is named for Confederate leader Robert E. Lee. 

Lee's School Advisory Council voted in October to change the name of the school, but the group's decision was nonbinding and any change would have to go through Superintendent Barbara Jenkins and be approved by the school board.
properties.headline: Lee Middle School group to ask community about possible name change

properties.summary: The council, with a 4-1 vote, rejected Montgomery County’s request to move the controversial statue to a spot in the city’s Beall Dawson Historic Park.
properties.headline: City of Rockville Rejects County’s Request to Take Controversial Confederate Statue

properties.summary: Last week’s decision by North East Independent School District trustees to not rename Robert E. Lee High School was one of many instances across Texas and the nation that have officials grappling with schools named after figures whose images have tarnished with time.
properties.headline: NEISD among districts throughout U.S. dealing with Confederate school names

properties.summary: Many cities from the old South are removing statues/memorials and are also renaming major roads that honored Confederate leaders. UT Austin also moved a Jefferson Davis statue to a museum.
properties.headline: Remove the Jefferson Davis Memorial

properties.summary: The Appomattox statue is protected by the Virginia statute concerning Memorials for War Veterans, which states that removing a memorial to any major war or conflict would be unlawful. Committee to change name of statue and roads is still indecisive.
properties.headline: Alexandria: Civil War Still Reverberates Indecision and conflict continues over Confederate street names and statues.

properties.summary: City Council voted to ban the flying of Confederate flags on city property specifically on those two days.
properties.headline: Alexandria City Council votes to ban flying of Confederate flag twice a year

properties.summary: You've heard the phrase "heritage not hate." It's a motto used by many people fighting for preservation of Confederate symbols.
properties.headline: Albertville man asks county to take down Confederate flag, monument

properties.summary:
The Confederate flag won’t be sold at the Washington County Fair after all.

Vendors got letters recently asking them not to sell items with the Confederate flag image because it was “disruptive.”

Vendors said the message was clear: the image was banned.
properties.headline: Washington County Fair Board reverses decision, bans Confederate flag

properties.summary: GA governor ordered redesign of Sons of the Confederate Veterans license plates; The Confederate flag battle emblem will remain on the new version of the license plate.
properties.headline: Rebel flag emblem to stay on redesigned version of specialty Georgia license plate

properties.summary:
They removed the Confederate battle flag from South Albany High School 20 years ago. A Confederate soldier does not dance during football games. This year, one of the school’s 10 black students led the cheers.

But every year, South Albany students and alumni ask themselves: Can we still call ourselves the Rebels?

The world has changed in the 40 years since the Linn County school broke away from Albany Union High. Earlier this month, South Carolina lawmakers even removed the Confederate battle flag from their state capitol grounds.

As South Albany has tried to craft a more generic Rebel, the community that surrounds it still fights to keep or give up the mascot. It’s a symbol of the underdog, blue-collar workers they are, some say. It’s offensive, others say, and has even scared off sports opponents from urban schools.

The perennial debate brings up questions of racism, school pride and the power of symbols. Can their mascot, symbolized by a Civil War-era soldier with a floppy mustache, ever signify something other than a uniformed defender of slavery?
properties.headline: South Albany High becoming Rebels in name only

properties.summary: Georgia's governor has quietly removed Confederate Memorial Day and Robert E. Lee's Birthday from the state calendar, replacing them with the innocuous-sounding designation "state holiday."
properties.headline: Georgia Governor Renames Confederate Holidays on State Calendar

properties.summary: Park officials are planning to replace a Confederate flag that once flew as part of a Wichita Park memorial to all soldiers who fought in the Civil War.
properties.headline: City to keep Confederate battle flag down in Veterans Memorial Park

properties.summary: As a renewed debate over the Confederate battle flag smoldered across the South this summer, Helen Anderson got online and – for the first time in her life – sent a message to the governor.
properties.headline: Quick anger, little action on Confederate plates in NC

properties.summary: Montgomery County Judge Steven Reed plans to ask Gov. Robert Bentley to go a step further in the removal of the Confederate battle flag from the Capitol by proposing the symbol be removed from any state-issued license plate.
properties.headline: Judge wants Confederate flag removed from car tags

properties.summary: Gov. Larry Hogan had asked Frosh on Thursday to quickly seek the court action to clear the way for the Motor Vehicle Administration to develop emergency regulations to recall Confederate logo plates already in use. The state has ceased issuing new plates with the logo.
properties.headline: Maryland asks federal court to allow recall of Confederate license plates

properties.summary: Rep. Alvin Holmes, (D-Montgomery) called on Gov. Robert Bentley to issue an executive order removing the flag from the patches on state trooper uniforms
properties.headline: New call to remove confederate flag from state trooper uniforms

properties.summary: The University of Mississippi quietly pulled down the state flag
properties.headline: Ole Miss Removes Mississippi Flag With Confederate Emblem

properties.summary: Proposals by a Monroe councilman to ban the sale and display of the Confederate flag on city-owned property and to allow the selling of beer and wine for special community events are being reviewed by the city’s law director.
properties.headline: Confederate flag ban on city property suggested

properties.summary: Athens’ most prominent Confederate flag, the one flying at the bar General Beauregard’s in the heart of downtown? Would new students, their families and campus visitors be welcomed to Athens in the fall with our massive Confederate monument on Broad Street, a bar named after Confederate general Stonewall Jackson and, most egregious, a bar flying the Confederate symbol out onto Clayton Street and named after the general who started the Civil War?
properties.headline: General Beauregard's Takes Down Its Rebel Flags, but Athens' Confederate Monument Remains

properties.summary: The Independence County Courthouse in Batesville, AR has removed the confederate flag that was originally erected by the Sons of the Confederate Veterans.
properties.headline: Confederate Flag Removed in Batesville

properties.summary: In three southern states on Monday, civil rights hero Martin Luther King Jr and civil war Confederate commander General Robert E Lee will share a common holiday. In Arkansas, however, they will do so for perhaps the final time. Asa Hutchinson, the state’s Republican governor, is pushing to separate the joint celebration after critics said it is an insult to the man who fought to end racial segregation to share a day with a man who fought to preserve slavery. “They need to be distinguished and separate,” Hutchinson told a news conference this month about the holidays.
properties.headline: Arkansas governor seeks to end MLK and Robert E Lee shared holiday

properties.summary: A polarizing symbol is disappearing from the Florida Senate, after senators endorsed a proposal Monday to remove the Confederate battle flag from their official seal.
properties.headline: Florida Senate to remove the Confederate battle flag from seal

properties.summary:
Her bill would stop the issuance and renewal of the Sons of Confederate Veterans specialized plates that don the flag. It would apply to all motor vehicles and motorcycles.

The fiscal note on the bill said as of Oct. 1, 2015, a little more than 3,000 specialty plates and 28 personalized plates were registered as SCV, displaying the flag.
properties.headline: Lawmakers discuss removing Confederate flag from license plates

properties.summary:
The questionable fate of the Confederate highway marker at Sewell Park has been debated since August, but it may cease to be a controversial topic as early as this spring.

Eric Algoe, Finance and Support Services president, said the status of the road marker commemorating the Confederacy has been an ongoing conversation in Faculty Senate.

“The Faculty Senate has been discussing the issue with President Trauth for some time, and they have been working on it consistently,” Algoe said. “We have sent a letter to the Texas Department of Transportation, officially requesting that the monument be moved, but we have not yet heard back from them.”

The university has been in the process of deciding what to do with the highway marker, which bears the name of Confederate President Jefferson Davis, since last summer.
properties.headline: Confederate President Jefferson Davis

properties.summary: Confederate flags are no longer allowed to be passed out to Veterans Day parade-goers.
properties.headline: Confederate Flag distribution banned from parade

properties.summary: A Confederate-marked flag that had flown outside Oregon's Capitol for a decade was quietly taken down early this week, state officials have confirmed.
properties.headline: Confederate emblem outside Oregon's Capitol has been removed

properties.summary:
The state House of Representatives approved a bill Thursday that would, if it becomes law, make it more difficult for a local government in Tennessee to alter, rename or remove a historical monument on public property.

The bill by Rep. Steve McDaniel, R-Parker's Crossroads, isn't limited to Civil War monuments and memorials, like Memphis's Nathan Bedford Forrest statue, but much of the 30-minute floor debate centered on the bill's impact on Civil War era iconography. It would replace and strengthen a 2013 law McDaniel sponsored as the Memphis City Council was renaming Forrest Park and two other Confederate-themed city parks.

The new bill would require a two-thirds majority vote by the 29-member Tennessee Historical Commission before a local government could "remove, rename, relocate, alter, rededicate or otherwise disturb or alter" any memorial or monument regarding a "historic conflict, historic event, historic figure or historic organization" located on public property. The 2013 statute required only a majority vote of the commission.
properties.headline: Bill makes it harder to alter Tennessee historical monuments

properties.summary: A federal judge in Danville cleared the way for the state to banish the flag from Sons of Confederate Veterans license plates. But attorneys for the group say the judge did not call for the existing plates to be returned to the state.
properties.headline: Recall of Va. Confederate flag plates meeting resistance

properties.summary:
The historic St. Paul’s Episcopal Church known as the “Cathedral of the Confederacy” has begun removing all images of the Confederate flag from within its walls. The measure includes six plaques with various versions of the Confederate flag, the church’s coat of arms with the flag on kneelers at the high altar, and bookplates in some books in the church’s library.
The needlepoint kneelers have already been removed from the sanctuary. The two plaques on opposite walls of the sanctuary honoring Confederate Gen. Robert E. Lee and the Confederacy’s president Jefferson Davis will be removed and placed in a not-yet-determined exhibit. Also in the exhibit will be a plaque installed in 1961 memorializing Confederate soldiers.
The plaques honoring Davis’ wife Varina Howell and daughter Varina Davis will be modified to remove the battle flag without removing the plaque from the church walls. A plaque honoring Frederic Robert Scott, an Ireland-born Confederate major, also will be modified to remove the battle flag.
properties.headline: St. Paul's Episcopal Church to remove images of Confederate flags

properties.summary: Gov. Rick Scott signed the bill (SB 310), which calls on the Department of State to select a prominent Floridian to replace General Edmund Kirby Smith’s statue in the National Statuary Hall
properties.headline: RICK SCOTT SIGNS BILL TO REPLACE GENERAL EDMUND KIRBY SMITH STATUE IN D.C.

properties.summary: The Fair Board ban the sale or display of Confederate flags and merchandise.
properties.headline: Confederate flag sales won’t be banned by Lorain County Fair

properties.summary:
Washington National Cathedral’s dean said that the prominent church needs to remove two stained-glass windows honoring Confederate generals Stonewall Jackson and Robert E. Lee — and depicting Confederate flags, images that he said were installed with “good and noble” intentions but have no place in 2015 as the country faces intense racial tensions and violence. While the windows still hang in their original space, his proposal is being reviewed by a task force that will make its recommendation to the cathedral's chapter, or board, possibly this spring, said Kevin Eckstrom, chief communications officer at the cathedral.
"For all we know, they could continue to remain in place for several years, or forever," Eckstrom said.
properties.headline: National cathedral windows are stirring a controversy

properties.summary: House committee passed bill to replace statue of Confederate general
properties.headline: Look at bills that passed, died in Florida this year

properties.summary: The hottest topic by far in Natchitoches is Mayor Lee Posey’s decision to ban the Confederate battle flag from the Natchitoches Christmas Parade.
properties.headline: Natchitoches mayor defends Confederate flag ban

properties.summary: The annual cash award to a student of government and legal studies who excels in constitutional law was named for the Confederate president. It was established in 1972 with an endowed gift from the United Daughters of the Confederacy, according to a news release from the college. In 1858, Davis received an honorary degree from Bowdoin College.
properties.headline: Bowdoin College drops award honoring Confederate president

properties.summary: The NAACP is calling on Mississippi to remove the Confederate battle emblem from its state flag.
properties.headline: NAACP: Mississippi should remove Confederate sign from flag

properties.summary: Yazoo City officials said they are joining other cities across the nation that are taking down their flags that have the Confederate emblem in their designs.
properties.headline: Yazoo City officials removing Mississippi state flag from city buildings

properties.summary: Mississippi State's Faculty Senate approved in August a resolution calling for a new state flag. The faculty vote was 37-1, with one abstention.
properties.headline: MSU Faculty Senate, student leaders call for flag change

properties.summary: Gov. Terry McAuliffe has vetoed legislation that would prevent Virginia cities from taking down monuments to the Confederacy and other war-related memorials, saying it would prohibit communities from making their own decisions about controversial symbols.
properties.headline: Civil War statues stay put for now: McAullife Vetoes Bill Barring Any Changes To Confederate Memorials in Virginia

properties.summary: The college is removing two Confederate marks from prominent locations on campus: a commemorative plaque bearing the names of William & Mary alumni who fought for the Confederacy in the Wren Building, and an emblem featuring the Confederate battle flag on the College Mace.
properties.headline: W&M Removes Confederate Symbols from Wren, College Mace

properties.summary: City Council voted to remove the Confederate flag from the city of Winchester's official seal and replace it with something that will reflect the city in a more favorable light
properties.headline: Confederate Battle Flag no longer part of the city of Winchester's official seal

properties.summary: Gov. Terry McAuliffe has vetoed legislation that would prevent Virginia cities from taking down monuments to the Confederacy and other war-related memorials, saying it would prohibit communities from making their own decisions about controversial symbols.
properties.headline: Civil War statues stay put for now

properties.summary: A meeting to examine results of a community survey about whether to rename Robert E. Lee Elementary quickly turned into a fiery debate Wednesday. San Diego Unified School District has been considering changing the name of the Paradise Hills school since people brought it up as being synonymous with hatred and segregation.
properties.headline: Community clashes over proposed school name change

properties.summary: A high school in the East Bay will move forward with plans to remove a controversial mascot. San Lorenzo High School's request to drop its cartoon mascot known as the "Rebel Guy" was granted by the school board in a unanimous vote late Tuesday. Many believe the Confederate-inspired image is dated and offensive.
properties.finalized: Yes (The school will keep the name Rebels)
properties.headline: School Board Votes to Drop San Lorenzo High School's 'Rebel Guy' Mascot

properties.summary: The Atlanta branch of the NAACP is calling for the immediate removal of all Confederate symbols from Stone Mountain Park, state-owned property that also houses a Civil War museum, hiking trails and other attractions.
properties.headline: NAACP: Banish Confederate symbols from Stone Mountain in Georgia

properties.summary: Ga Governor Nathan Deal agreed to erect a memorial to honor MLKs legacy on top of Stone Mountain, near Confederate symbols.
properties.headline: A monument to MLK will crown Stone Mountain

properties.summary: The Boone County Commission decided to move the controversial symbol after an online petition was started seeking its removal from government property. The 5½-ton boulder was removed early Saturday from the lawn of the Boone County Courthousem and will be placed at the historic site of the Battle of Centralia.
properties.headline: Confederate Rock finds new home at Centralia battlefield site

properties.summary:
The state flag of Mississippi will no longer fly on Washington County properties.

The Washington County Board of Supervisors voted Monday 3-2 in favor of removing the flag, which features a Confederate emblem, from county properties, according to the Delta Democrat-Times. The Concerned Ministers and Citizens of Washington County had been petitioning for the removal of the flag over the past year.
properties.headline: Mississippi county will stop flying state flag

properties.summary: Hillsborough’s Historic District Commission has voted to allow removing the words “Confederate Memorial” from the Orange County Historical Museum.
properties.headline: Confederate tribute to be removed from town library

properties.summary: Whether as an act of political correctness or in the spirit of promoting equality, it seems the urge to erase indications of America’s racist past (and present) has also taken hold of the Orange County Historical Museum in North Carolina. The museum has removed the words “Confederate Memorial” from its edifice to avoid confusing patrons into thinking the building is in some way dedicated to the history of the Confederacy. Instead, the museum is focused on the history of the county, though the name would not reflect that, according to museum officials.
properties.headline: North Carolina Museum Attempts to Part With Sordid Confederate History

properties.summary: Tired of waiting for a response from the city of Goose Creek,a warning that it will do whatever’s necessary to get the Confederate flag symbol off the city’s welcome signs, including a boycott.
properties.headline: Activists threaten boycott over Confederate emblem on Goose Creek sign

properties.summary: Opponents of Charlottesville's effort to remove the statue of Confederate General Robert E. Lee are planning a rally for Monday (April 18) afternoon... Monday night, City Councilors are expected to discuss the future of those Confederate memorials. Some of the questions on the table: should the city add, subtract, or change the statues.
properties.headline: City Council to Discuss Confederate Monuments, Protests Planned

properties.summary: The board's decision was unanimous to keep the nickname, with members saying the mascot's affiliation with the Confederacy ended two decades ago.
properties.headline: South Burlington keeps Rebel nickname

properties.summary: Montgomery officials will discuss the design of the city's seal and the city's flag, both of which either allude to or mention the Confederacy.
properties.headline: Montgomery considers removing Confederate symbols from seal, flag

properties.summary: By an 8-2 vote, the street name will be changed to Springer Boulevard after the Springer family, whose members have included clergy, farmers, businessmen and a family physician.
properties.headline: Arkansas capital renames street long known as Confederate Boulevard

properties.summary: Rep. Darryl Rouson, has filed legislation that would ban the display of Confederate flags and symbols on publicly owned or leased property.
properties.headline: Bradenton-area lawmaker Darryl Rouson files bill to outlaw Confederate flag on public property

properties.summary: The Lawrence school board’s policy advisory committee is weighing whether to recommend a districtwide ban on the Confederate flag.
properties.headline: Lawrence school board committee considers ban on Confederate flag

properties.summary:
While South Carolina removed the Confederate flag that was flying over its Capitol, Kentucky left Davis, who was born in Todd County, in place.

During the gubernatorial campaign, Gov. Matt Bevin said he favored removing the statue.

"It is important never to forget our history, but parts of our history are more appropriately displayed in museums, not on government property," Bevin said in a statement.
properties.headline: Davis statue draws ire at black history rally
Ricky Jones | Remove Confederate statue at U of L

properties.summary:
The monument depicting Mouton in his Confederate uniform was erected in 1922 by the United Daughters of the Confederacy Alfred Mouton chapter.

A group calling itself Y Alfred? wants the city to consider moving the statue, possibly to the Lafayette Museum property, once owned by Alfred Mouton's father, or consider adding context, history and accuracy to the monument if it stays.

Co-founder Morgan Pierce said Y Alfred? takes issue with Mouton's activity in a pre-war vigilante group that, according to some accounts, targeted blacks and other ethnic groups, forcing them from their homes, even beating and killing some.
properties.headline: Comment possible Tuesday on Confederate general statue

properties.summary:
he Talbot County Council has announced that the Talbot Boys monument will remain on the county courthouse lawn despite protest and debate.

The council made the announcement Tuesday night during a packed meeting.

The monument is the only Civil War memorial on the grounds. It lists the names of Confederate war dead and also bears a statue of a Confederate color bearer holding a Confederate flag.

Council President Corey Pack says the council will permit the erection of a monument commemorating Union soldiers.
properties.headline: Talbot Boys statue to remain on Easton courthouse lawn

properties.summary: Farm Show vendors have been told they can’t sell certain products — those featuring the Confederate flag.
properties.headline: Farm Show vendors ordered to stop selling Confederate flag merchandise

properties.summary: Darlington Raceway will give out American flags to those who want to turn in a Confederate flag, continuing an initiative that began in Daytona soon after nine people were killed at a church in Charleston.
properties.headline: Darlington Raceway to give out American flags, collect Confederate flags

properties.summary: The police chief and mayor of Gettysburg, South Dakota, aren't backing down after criticism of a Confederate flag patch on the local police department's uniform. Rather than remove the offending symbol, the town is embracing it even more.
properties.headline: This South Dakota Town Refuses To Take The Confederate Flag Off Its Police Uniform

properties.summary: The Fort Worth Stock Show and Rodeo has changed its policy this year to disallow Confederate battle flags on display during events and activities.
properties.headline: Fort Worth Stock Show And Rodeo Bans Confederate Battle Flag

properties.summary: Spotsylvania area fire department reverses decision on Confederate patch. "Chancellor Volunteer Fire and Rescue’s new president resigned Monday night just before members “overwhelmingly” voted to overturn the reinstatement of a uniform patch depicting a Confederate battle flag, Administrative Chief Kevin Dillard said."
properties.headline: Spotsylvania area fire department reverses decision on Confederate patch

properties.summary: The University of Alabama is replacing the portrait of a Confederate general and U.S. senator in Morgan Hall with an exhibit from a collection of African-American art donated to UA in 2008.
properties.headline: Confederate general's portrait replaced in Morgan Hall

properties.summary: Oifficials at the Grand Junction Veterans Affairs Medical Center have called for the removal of the Confederate flag from a mural inside the facility's cafeteria.
properties.headline: Confederate flag banned from mural at VA

properties.summary: Marion commissioners vote to relocate Confederate flag from the front of a government complex to an area nearby a fitness trail and the Marion County Museum of History and Archaeology
properties.headline: Marion County will fly different Confederate flag closer to museum

properties.summary:
The controversial Confederate statue that's sat on county property for 111 years will remain there, at least for now.

The board of directors at the Matheson History Museum voted 9-2 Tuesday evening not to accept the statue, offered by the Alachua County commission in late September.

Bob Ackerman, a member of the Matheson History Museum's board of directors, said the board decided not to take the statue after a 1½-hour discussion for several reasons, but mostly because they didn't want the controversy and didn't want to be saddled with the cost of moving the statue.

“The museum is not in the business to divide the community,” he said.
properties.headline: Matheson Museum turns down Confederate statue

properties.summary: Plans are in the works for a monument containing a confederate flag to come down here in Charlotte. It's been standing on East Morehead Street for over 20 years, but the North Carolina Military Institute monument's days are numbered.
properties.headline: Dowd YMCA Removes Confederate Monument

properties.summary: City Manager Ron Carlee says that the monument that used to sit outside the Old City Hall will be moved to Elmwood Cemetery.
properties.headline: Confederate monument to move to Charlotte cemetery

properties.summary: Confederate flags will no longer be allowed on vehicles at a southwestern Ohio high school.
properties.headline: Confederate flag no longer allowed at Ohio high school

properties.summary:
State Representative Garnet Coleman, a democrat from Houston, is starting a petition to rename Dowling Street as Emancipation Avenue.
It was originally East Broadway Street, but in 1892, the Houston City Council voted to rename it after Confederate Major Richard “Dick” Dowling.
properties.headline: Texas Lawmakers Petition To Rename Houston Street Named After Confederate Leader

properties.summary: Texas’ largest school district has joined the national debate over whether communities should cut their ties to the Confederacy by renaming buildings or removing monuments.
properties.headline: 4 Houston schools to shed Confederate names

properties.summary: A portrait of Confederate Gen. J.E.B. Stuart has been removed from a Patrick County courtroom.
properties.headline: Judge removes confederate portrait from Stuart courtroom

properties.summary: Confederate memorabilia have been removed from display in the Pittsylvania County Circuit Courthouse following an order from Judge Stacey W. Moreau.
properties.headline: Confederate memorabilia removed from Pittsylvania courtroom

properties.summary:
The Third National flag of the Confederacy will not return to the grounds of the Sutherlin Mansion anytime soon, following a ruling by Danville Circuit Court Judge James Reynolds during a motions hearing Thursday.
Reynolds dismissed a complaint against the city filed by Heritage Preservation Association and several co-plaintiffs, seeking the return of the flag to a flagpole atop a memorial where it has flown for two decades.
The judge ruled that the 1994 resolution by Danville City Council accepting ownership of the granite monument and flagpole, while giving the HPA permission to maintain the Third National flag of the Confederacy on the flagpole, did not constitute a contract.
properties.headline: Confederate flag won’t return to Sutherlin Mansion

properties.summary: The Mobile City Council voted Tuesday to remove the Confederate flag and other banners from the official seal of city government following complaints that the Old South symbol depicted racism and intolerance.
properties.headline: Mobile removing Confederate flag from city seal

properties.summary: A ceremony Wednesday fulfilled a promise Santa Ana and county officials made this summer to rid county property of the Confederate symbol by replacing the 50 state flags that have flown at the Plaza of the Flags since the 1970s.
properties.headline: Mississippi state flag comes down at Santa Ana Civic Center

properties.summary: After putting the Confederate flag conversation on hold for several months, Milton City Council voted unanimously on Monday to replace the Confederate battle flag on its city seal with the First National Flag of the Confederacy.
properties.headline: Milton replacing Confederate flag [Replacing w/ Confed National Flag]

properties.summary: The seven-member commission, appointed by Mayor Stephanie Rawlings-Blake to consider what to do with Baltimore's four Confederate-era monuments, voted narrowly to remove two of them. The mayor must now make a final decision.
properties.headline: Baltimore City commission recommends removal of two Confederate monuments

properties.summary: St. Louis Mayor Francis Slay has decided a monument in Forest Park celebrating the Confederacy should be moved to a museum, but that private donors will have to pay for it.
properties.headline: Slay seeks removal of Confederate memorial in Forest Park

properties.summary: Mayor announced that no Confederate flag would be flown, notes Union allegiance of area. There was no Confederate flag to take down.
properties.headline: Mayor: Greeneville Town Hall Won't Fly Confederate Flag

properties.summary: A Georgetown church congregation has started a petition drive to remove the Confederate statue from the Williamson County Courthouse grounds.
properties.headline: Williamson County commissioners: Confederate statue should stay

properties.summary: No timeline for any change was included in the plan when the plan was shown to university students and faculty in February. The plan was not expected to be finalized until the summer, said Patti Miller, MTSU's campus architect and assistant vice president for campus planning.
properties.headline: Forrest Hall not included in draft MTSU plan

properties.summary: After voting to drop a Confederate general’s name from their school last month, students at John B. Hood Middle School indicated Monday that they want the name Piedmont Global Academy to grace their building.
properties.headline: Dallas students who voted to drop Confederate general’s name from school have selected a new one

properties.summary: Forrest street was named after a Confederate War general who happened to be the founder of the KKK
properties.headline: Hollywood to research renaming street named for KKK founder

properties.summary: Debate swirls in a Johnson County community after a student displayed a confederate flag at school.
properties.headline: Confederate flag stirs emotions at Johnson County school

properties.summary: There's approximately 4.5 million vehicles registered in Louisiana, according to Louisiana State Police, and about 160 of them are driving around with valid license plates featuring an image of the Confederate flag.
properties.headline: License plates featuring Confederate flag still issued in Louisiana

properties.summary:
New Orleans Parish Councilman James Gray is in favor of taking down the four Confederate monuments in the city, but he does not believe the Confederate engraving should be removed. 
"I think it's a real difference in having a mere historical account than having a statue that is set in a place of honor and being maintained by taxpayer dollars," Gray said.
properties.headline: Mayor pushes to remove Confederate flag etching on City Hall

properties.summary: Lee Circle will lose the statue of its namesake after the New Orleans City Council voted 6-1 Thursday to remove four monuments related to the Confederacy from their prominent perches around the city.
properties.headline: Lee Circle no more: New Orleans to remove 4 Confederate statues

properties.summary:
Walpole High School will do what it can to keep its novel “Rebel” name but School Committee members vowed Thursday to rebrand the association from its historical Confederate connection to new Revolutionary imagery.
 Included in the unanimous 6-0 vote, the board decided to permanently display a Walpole Rebels “W” logo banner to block a neighbor’s Confederate flag overlooking the high school’s athletic complex along with a message stating the private flag is not representative of the school.
properties.headline: School Committee aims to rebrand the Walpole 'Rebel' while keeping traditional name

properties.summary:
Robert E. Lee Park has a new name — Lake Roland — and next year will have a new nature center, too.

Baltimore County Executive Kevin Kamenetz announced the new name of the park during a groundbreaking ceremony Monday for the $1.2 million Lake Roland Nature and Environmental Education Center, which is expected to open in April 2016.

Kamenetz said all references to Robert E. Lee Park have been removed and Lake Roland substituted as the park name on the county website. The Robert E. Lee Park Nature Council also has changed its name to the Lake Roland Nature Council and its new website address is www.lakeroland.org.
properties.headline: Baltimore County renaming Robert E. Lee Park as Lake Roland

properties.summary:
The debate has also sparked a similar one in the Bronx, where one councilman is pushing to change the name of Longstreet Avenue in Throgs Neck.

The road is named after James Longstreet, who was a Confederate general during the Civil War. Longstreet was originally from New Jersey but became a cotton merchant in New Orleans after the war.
properties.headline: Councilman urges Confederate street name change

properties.summary: Confederate symbols at South Garland High School are history.The decision to remove and replace the controversial symbols is final, according to the Garland Independent School District.
properties.headline: Garland school removes Confederate symbols

properties.summary: The Austin-American Statesman reports: "The statues of Davis, who led the Confederacy, and Wilson, the nation's 28th president, will be refurbished before they are placed in new settings. The Davis statue will be installed in 18 months or so in UT's Briscoe Center for American History after the center is renovated, while Wilson's will be placed at a yet-to-be-decided outdoor location on campus, according to university officials."
properties.headline: Jefferson Davis Statue Comes Down At University of Texas

properties.summary: The Austin school board Monday night voted to allow the name change of a school named from a Confederate general.
properties.headline: Austin school board approves Robert E. Lee Elementary name change

properties.summary: Any symbols from hate groups are also not allowed to be worn or displayed on school property.
properties.headline: School board bans Confederate Flag from Montgomery County schools in new dress code

properties.summary: The four flags remain depicted on several state of Alabama seals, including the official coat of arms and the governor's seal. Baldwin County's change came after its archives division deemed the flags historically inaccurate.
properties.headline: Baldwin County votes to replace four flags from its seal including Confederate Battle Flag

properties.summary: While the Confederate battle flag is coming down from the State House grounds in South Carolina and around the nation, it continues to fly here in St. Mary's County, at the center of a privately owned monument next to the largest burial site of rebel soldiers in Maryland.
properties.headline: At Point Lookout in Southern Maryland, Confederate flag still flies

properties.summary: The presidents of the Gulfport and Biloxi branches of the NAACP asked the Harrison County Board of Supervisors to remove the Mississippi state flag from all county property, saying the inclusion of the Confederate Battle Flag in the corner is inherently racist.
properties.headline: NAACP requests removal of state flag from Harrison County property

properties.summary: Coast NAACP leader Curley Clark asked Jackson County supervisors on Monday to take down the Mississippi flag from all county property because of the racist reference to the Confederate battle flag in one corner.
properties.headline: Jackson County NAACP: 'Do the right thing' and take down state flag
